intro: Zephyranthes ciceroana, commonly known as the Cicero's rain lily, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom after rainfall. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Its bulbs are underground and serve as storage organs, allowing the plant to survive dry periods. Zephyranthes ciceroana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and its ability to bloom in response to rain.
